transcripts.text: Extra Good Citizens'.  John Gray was reporting on a campaign event for Brazoria County Sheriff candidate Richard Foreman when off-duty deputies stole his camera and assaulted him.

No, don't touch my stuff.  Do not touch my body cam right now.  Do not touch my stuff.  Give me my stuff back.  Give me my stuff back.  Give me my stuff back.  Give me my stuff back.  This is a public event.  Get your hands off me.  Get your hands off me.  Get your hands off me.  Get your hands off me.
Thank you, stop.
In part one of this video series, Lake Jackson police refused to take a police report.
I talked to Sergeant Estesra prior to coming here.  He told me to inform you to contact Brazoria County Sheriff's Department.
I'm here to make a criminal complaint.
I'm just letting you know what he told me.  He said our administration, Lake Jackson administration, told him to refer you to Brazoria County.
But it happened in Lake Jackson.  There was an assault in Lake Jackson.
In Brazoria County, correct?
Yes, but it was an assault that took place at a Lake Jackson building.
Okay.  I said, I'm telling you what our administration said.
So I need you to take the criminal complaint, man.  I need you to take the criminal complaint.
They told me to refer you to County.

No, this happened.  This is a crime that was committed in Lake Jackson.  You're the Lake Jackson Police Department, right?  Okay, sorry.  A crime that happened in Lake Jackson.  on Lake Jackson City property, there's absolutely no reason why I have to go to Brazoria County for that.
I was advised by my administrator.
And what is the administrator's name?
His name is Assistant Chief Chris Anderson.  Okay.  He advised me that if you came up here to talk to you and advise you that because it was involving an off-duty county deputy.
So basically, crimes that happen in Lake Jackson.

Mr.  Gray?
How are you?  What's your name and badge number, sir?
Deputy Mayor, Sheriff's Office.  Badge number is 1801.
1801.  All right.  So I need a... do a criminal complaint against an assault.  The assault actually happened in Lake Jackson at the Civic Center.
Okay.
They told me it was an off-duty officer, even though he never identified as an off-duty officer.
Okay.
Did they tell you what agency he worked for?
Apparently, it was already found.  Okay.  His name is Stephen Buchanan.  Okay.  I know the name.
He does not work in my division, though.  Okay.
So I need to, have you seen the video yet?  I mean, I'm assuming you know about it.
I've heard about it.  Yes, sir.
I know who you are.
Like I said, we kind of got a briefing long before I came to patrol.
I heard about you because of what incident that happened.
that did happen prior to my employment here.  But... As far as the, are you wanting to make a complaint?
Oh, criminal complaint.  Criminal complaint.
So a criminal charge against him.  Because it happened in the city of Lake Jackson, that is a charge that needs to be filed with the city of Lake Jackson, unless they refer you back to us.
They did refer us back.  We went by there, and they said that the assistant chief over there said to come over here.
And to file a criminal charge?  Okay.
And this is... I don't know if you know who Richard Portman is, he's running for sheriff.
Sure.

This was at his campaign event inside the Lake Jackson Civic Center.  I need to file a criminal complaint and... They said I can't do that in Lake Jackson.  I have to file a criminal complaint here, and that's what I'd like to do.  I noticed you haven't written anything down yet.  I was just wondering.

Everything's being recorded.  In the event that we go ahead and file a charge, we'll get a written statement and everything, okay?  Because that's not how stuff normally works.  It usually is filed in the agency that it's in the jurisdiction that it occurred in.  Let me go ahead and call my sergeant and ask him what he wants to do.  if they refer you back to us, and then I'll get back with you real quick, okay?
Okay, no problem.
All right, man.

like I said, because this isn't how it generally works with us filing an assault that occurred in different, or assault or any charge whatsoever in a different jurisdiction, my sergeant said that you can either go back to Lake Jackson and request that they take it again, or you can come back up here during regular business hours and speak with the administrator.  They should be taking that charge, and if not, there needs to be a reason why, and they need to contact us and tell us why.  Okay.  And as far as, like I said, apparently he saw the video.  Again, I have not seen it.  He said that you need to be sure that you know exactly where the assault occurred and how to explain it, okay?
Now this isn't filing charges on a police officer or opening an investigation.  It's merely taking a police report.
And they won't even do that.

I guess a public paper trail might be politically inconvenient.  And this runaround is completely opposite from what Lake Jackson Police Department told me last year.  I was stopped by police while campaigning against establishment politician Dennis Bonin.  They said they'd take every call.

Yeah, y'all are good to go, man.  Like I said, just be aware, we're going to get called.  We have to stop and talk to you.  That's what we have to do.  It's our job.  Okay. Well, yeah, we have to respond.  I mean, it could be for anything.  Okay.  Yeah, I mean. We have to talk to you.  Okay.  We have to make every effort to contact you.  That's good to know.  Yeah.  All right.

I guess I shouldn't be surprised.  I experienced similar abuse during the last primary election.  I was a vocal opponent of State Representative Dennis Bonnen.  He's the Speaker of the Texas House.  When I went to vote at the Lake Jackson Civic Center, Bonnen accosted me and threatened me.  After voting, I went immediately to the police department to make a report.  Lake Jackson police investigated me like a suspect, asked invasive questions like whether I had a gun, and ultimately nothing was done.  It all finally caught up to Bonnen.  He's ending his legislative career after a massive scandal involving allegations of bribery.  City Manager Bill Yenny eventually told me that the police department would take John's complaint.  I have once again talked with the assistant chief.  My understanding is that Mr.  Gray will be coming in and making his statement, and a case will then be forwarded to the DA's office.  I interpreted this as the Lake Jackson Police Department getting his wife to file charges on John.  Yes, that's right, the city manager's wife is a district attorney.  By the way, Jerry Yenny refused to recuse herself during the Dennis Bonin scandal, and she refused to file criminal charges against him.  Lake Jackson police later took John's report of the alleged criminal offense.  They also provided a copy of Sergeant Necestra's body camera for $28.  The full body camera is available on the Extra Good Citizen channel, I put a link to it in the video description.

I'm John Gray.  David Hawkinson.  Nice to meet you as well.  On January 16th, I went into the Richard Foreman for Sheriff event over at the Civic Center.  I walked in.  I sat at the table.  A few minutes later, a gentleman asked me if I could step outside and talk with him.  I declined that offer.  At that point, he took my camera and everything, stole my property.  It was only after making a very big fuss that he gave my property back.  And he also assaulted me, pushing me, hitting me several times.  I had my hands up the entire time, and I'd like to file a criminal complaint.  I also brought you a copy of the video right here.  Okay, thank you.  That's for you.
Do you want to give a sworn statement, or do you just want to tell me that you were assaulted and I should look into it?
What do you suggest doing in order to get criminal charges pressed against whoever this person was?  I believe his name was Stephen Buchanan.
Okay.  So I'm going to take this.  This is for me, right?
Yes, sir.  Yes, sir.  She can have it.

And then before you sign, I'll ask you to swear to, and we're going to notarize it.  Okay.  You can decline any of this if you don't want to.

I'm going to wait with you, or...
If you want to, you're welcome to.  All right, so my statement says, I'm speaking to my streamers as well, I was assaulted at the Civic Center on January 16th.
Do you want to add a line, something along the lines of, I wish to file any and all applicable charges?  That's kind of a standard thing.  Okay.  It's up to you.
No, no, no, that's exactly what I'm trying to do here.
And then before you sign it, do you solemnly swear another penalties of perjury that the statements contained in this document are true?
I do.  Okay, right here, please.
And then I'm going to notarize it.  Let me make you copy that.

Although late is better than never, the Lake Jackson Police Department should have investigated the allegation at the time of the incident instead of soliciting a criminal trespass notice against the victim.

Mr.  Gray, at this point, you're a criminal trespass for the Civic Center property.  That contains all this parking lot, even up to the back of the police department.  So you are no longer welcome on this property.  You need to vacate immediately or you will be arrested.

Foreman's gang of law officers want to take John out.  They think he's an easy target.  And only with your help can John stand up to these bullies and defeat tyranny.  Let us know what you think by leaving a comment.
